questions.question: ‘I didn’t pass the test.’ ‘…………………………. did I.’
questions.description: After a negative statement, we can add another negative statement to it with neither or nor.

questions.question: I am …………………………… happy.
questions.description: We do not use so much to modify adjectives and adverbs.

questions.question: Start at once, …………………………… you do not miss the train.
questions.description: Either so that or in order that cannot be used here.

questions.question: I waited for ………………………… two hours but he didn’t come.
questions.description: We can use another with plural expressions of quantity.

questions.question: Buses leave ………………………….. ten minutes.
questions.description: Every can be used before plural expressions in measurements of frequency.

questions.question: My ……………………………… been stolen.
questions.description: Baggage does not have a plural form.

questions.question: Alice and James ……………………………. agreed to come.
questions.description: When two singular nouns are connected by and, the verb should be plural.

questions.question: He sings as well as ………………………… the guitar.
questions.description: He sings as well as playing the guitar means 'He not only plays the guitar, but also sings.'

questions.question: The more he earns, the …………………………. he spends.
questions.description: Less is the comparative form of little. The comparative is used in both clauses in this structure.

questions.question: It is cruel …………………………… animals in that way.
I was …………………………. tired that I couldn’t walk any further.
